wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the ezbillify-v1 system. Explain its purpose as a full-stack business management platform with integrated accounting, sales, purchase, inventory, and GST compliance functionality for businesses in India. Describe the high-level architecture using Next.js, React, Supabase, and Tailwind CSS. Document the relationship between frontend components, API routes, services, and database. Include both conceptual overviews for beginners and technical details for experienced developers. Provide practical examples of core workflows such as sales process (quotation → invoice → payment), purchase process (PO → GRN → bill), and month-end closing. Illustrate key concepts with diagrams showing system context and major component interactions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Frontend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the frontend architecture of ezbillify-v1. Describe the component-based React architecture using Next.js, with a focus on layout components like AppLayout and AuthLayout. Document the use of React Context (AuthContext, CompanyContext) for global state management and the pattern of custom hooks (useAuth, useAPI) for encapsulating reusable logic. Explain the component hierarchy and organization by feature domains (sales, purchase, accounting, etc.) and shared UI components. Detail the routing strategy using Next.js pages directory, including both UI pages and API routes. Include information on styling with Tailwind CSS and the use of UI component libraries. Address performance considerations such as code splitting, lazy loading, and client-server data fetching patterns. Provide examples of component composition and state management patterns used throughout the application.

wiki_catalogs.name: Quotations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Quotations feature in ezbillify-v1. Explain the implementation of quotation creation, editing, and conversion to sales orders or invoices. Document the data model including customer association, item details, pricing, taxes, and validity periods. Include practical examples from the codebase showing form handling in QuotationForm.js and API interactions via the quotations API route. Describe integration points with customer management and item pricing. Address common issues such as expired quotations, pricing mismatches, and tax configuration errors. Provide guidance on best practices for quotation workflows and performance considerations when handling large quotation volumes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Item Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the item management sub-feature of the inventory system. Explain the implementation of creating, editing, and viewing items with support for barcode, categories, units, and inventory tracking settings. Document the data model including fields like name, SKU, barcode, category, unit, tax rates, pricing, and warehouse location. Include practical examples from the codebase such as handling inventory tracking flags, reorder levels, max stock levels, and warehouse location (aisle, bay, level, position). Describe the integration between the ItemForm component and the useInventory hook for CRUD operations. Address common issues like duplicate SKUs, barcode validation, and handling items with and without inventory tracking. Provide guidance on best practices for organizing item catalogs and maintaining data consistency.

wiki_catalogs.name: Purchase Orders
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Purchase Orders sub-feature in ezbillify-v1. Explain the implementation of creating, viewing, editing, and tracking purchase orders. Document the data model including fields like document_number, vendor_id, item details, tax calculations, and status tracking. Include practical examples from the codebase showing how purchase orders are created via the PurchaseOrderForm and persisted through the API route. Describe the relationship between purchase orders and other entities such as vendors, items, and GRNs. Address common issues like validation errors during creation, status synchronization problems when receiving goods, and handling branch-specific procurement. Provide guidance on best practices for managing large purchase orders and optimizing performance during high-volume operations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Journal Entries
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the journal entries system in ezbillify-v1. Thoroughly explain the implementation of double-entry accounting principles, including how journal entries are created, validated, and posted. Document the data model for journal entries and journal entry items, including fields like entry_number, entry_date, narration, total_debit, total_credit, and status. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how users create, view, edit, and delete journal entries through the JournalList component and associated API routes. Explain the relationship between journal entries and other accounting modules like general ledger and financial statements. Address common issues such as unbalanced entries, posting errors, and handling of draft vs posted entries. Provide guidance on best practices for maintaining audit trails and ensuring data integrity.

wiki_catalogs.name: e-Invoicing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the e-Invoicing sub-feature of the GST compliance system. Thoroughly explain the implementation details of generating, tracking, and managing e-Invoices through the Whitebooks GSP integration. Document the complete workflow from invoice creation in the system to IRN generation and QR code embedding. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase, such as the EInvoiceList component's handling of status filtering and the API route for e-Invoice generation. Explain the relationship between frontend components, API routes, and the gstService.js business logic layer. Address common issues like IRN generation failures, authentication token expiration, and sandbox vs production environment differences. Provide performance optimization tips for batch e-Invoice generation during high-volume periods.

wiki_catalogs.name: Chart of Accounts
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Chart of Accounts implementation in ezbillify-v1. Explain the hierarchical structure of accounts, account types (asset, liability, equity, income, expense), and coding conventions used. Document the form validation rules, parent-child relationships, and circular reference prevention mechanisms in AccountForm.js. Describe the API endpoints for CRUD operations and how account data is consumed across sales, purchase, and accounting modules. Include practical examples of setting up a new account, configuring sub-accounts, and troubleshooting common issues like invalid account hierarchies or inactive account usage. Address performance considerations when dealing with large chart of accounts and best practices for maintaining data integrity.

wiki_catalogs.name: Sales Reports
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the sales reporting module in ezbillify-v1. Thoroughly explain the implementation of bill-wise, customer-wise, and product-wise sales reports, including their data sources, filtering parameters, and aggregation logic. Document the integration between frontend components and the backend API endpoint at /api/accounting/reports/sales-reports.js, detailing request/response schemas and authentication requirements. Include practical examples from the codebase showing how date ranges, customer segments, and product categories are used to generate insights. Explain the use of the useReports hook for data fetching and error handling. Address common issues such as incomplete data retrieval, performance bottlenecks with large sales datasets, and discrepancies in tax calculations. Provide optimization tips including proper indexing strategies, result caching, and pagination techniques for large result sets.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Components Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the UI components architecture in ezbillify-v1. Describe the component-based design using React with a clear separation between layout components (AppLayout, AuthLayout), navigation elements (Sidebar, TopBar), and reusable UI primitives (Button, Input, Table). Document the organization of shared components under the 'shared' directory by functional categories such as forms, data display, feedback, and navigation. Explain the use of composition patterns to build complex interfaces from simpler components. Detail styling implementation using Tailwind CSS and how responsive design is achieved across different screen sizes. Include examples of component usage from key features like sales, purchase, and accounting modules. Address accessibility considerations, theming support via ThemeContext, and performance optimizations like memoization and lazy loading of heavy components.

wiki_catalogs.name: Document Numbering
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the document numbering configuration system in ezbillify-v1. Thoroughly explain the implementation of sequential numbering for various document types including invoices, purchase orders, quotations, and sales orders. Document configuration options for custom prefixes, suffixes, padding, and reset policies (monthly, yearly, or continuous). Include practical examples from the codebase showing how numbering sequences are generated and validated. Explain the relationship between document numbering and company-specific settings. Address common issues such as sequence gaps, duplicate numbers, and migration challenges. Provide best practices for maintaining audit-compliant numbering in multi-branch and multi-company environments. Describe how the system handles concurrent document creation and ensures uniqueness.

wiki_catalogs.name: Client-Side Data Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the client-side data flow in ezbillify-v1. Detail how React components like JournalList initiate data requests through custom hooks such as useAPI, which abstracts API communication logic. Explain the role of useAuth and AuthContext in managing authentication state and injecting JWT tokens into API requests. Document the service layer pattern where accountingService.js and similar service modules encapsulate business logic and format requests before sending them to Next.js API routes. Illustrate the complete flow: component → hook → service → fetch → API route, including loading states, error handling via ToastContext, and response parsing. Include examples of GET and POST operations, describe caching behavior using React state and useEffect, and explain how real-time updates are handled. Address common issues like stale data, authentication timeouts, and network error recovery.

wiki_catalogs.name: Profit & Loss Statement
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Profit & Loss statement component in ezbillify-v1. Explain how the component fetches and displays income, expenses, cost of goods sold (COGS), gross profit, and net profit over a specified date range. Document the integration with the accountingService.getProfitLoss method and the underlying Supabase RPC call 'get_profit_loss'. Describe the UI structure including period selection, data visualization, and export functionality (Excel, PDF, JSON). Include examples from the ProfitLoss.js component showing state management, data formatting, and error handling. Explain how income and expenses are categorized from the chart of accounts and how the report supports financial analysis and decision-making. Address common issues such as missing data, incorrect account classifications, and performance optimization for large datasets. Provide guidance on interpreting profitability metrics and trends.

wiki_catalogs.name: Context Providers
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the React Context providers in ezbillify-v1. Explain the implementation and responsibilities of each context: AuthContext for managing user authentication state, CompanyContext for current company data, BranchContext for active branch selection, ThemeContext for UI theme persistence, and ToastContext for global notification state. Document the provider components' structure, state initialization using useEffect and useLocalStorage, and the value object exposed to consumers. Include examples of how these contexts are wrapped in _app.js to enable global access. Describe the update mechanisms via context-specific setter functions and how Provider components are used in the component tree. Address best practices for avoiding unnecessary re-renders through context splitting and memoization. Explain error boundaries and fallback behaviors when contexts are consumed outside their providers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Routing Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the routing strategy in ezbillify-v1. Explain the Next.js file-based routing system using the pages directory, detailing how UI routes are structured for core modules like sales, purchase, accounting, and GST. Describe the role of _app.js in initializing context providers (AuthContext, ToastContext, BranchContext) and its impact on global application state. Document the implementation of protected routes using AuthGuard to enforce authentication, company setup requirements, and role-based access control. Cover dynamic routing patterns using [id].js for entity-specific views and editing. Explain the routing behavior during authentication flows, including redirects for unauthenticated users and post-login navigation. Include examples of route change detection and cleanup in components like InvoiceList. Address how layout components integrate with routing and how navigation events are handled across the application.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the ezbillify-v1 technology stack. Explain the role of each major technology: Next.js for server-side rendering and API routes, React for component-based UI development, Supabase for database and authentication, Tailwind CSS for utility-first styling, and @react-pdf/renderer for document generation. Document version compatibility, configuration options, and integration patterns between these technologies. Include practical examples showing how these technologies work together in the codebase, such as API routes using Supabase client or components using Tailwind classes. Address common setup issues and their solutions. Provide performance optimization tips for this technology combination.

wiki_catalogs.name: Backend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the backend architecture of ezbillify-v1. Describe the API routes implementation in Next.js as serverless functions, detailing the request handling pattern and response formatting. Document the service layer pattern where business logic is encapsulated in service modules (accountingService, customerService, etc.) that are consumed by API routes. Explain the middleware architecture for authentication and authorization using both client-side and server-side middleware. Detail the integration with Supabase for database operations and authentication. Include information on error handling, input validation, and security practices implemented in the API layer. Provide examples of API route implementations and their corresponding service functions, showing the flow from HTTP request to database operation and response generation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Sales Orders
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Sales Orders feature in ezbillify-v1. Thoroughly explain the implementation of sales order creation, management, and fulfillment tracking. Document the domain model including relationships with customers, items, inventory availability, and downstream documents like invoices and delivery notes. Include concrete examples from SalesOrderForm.js and the associated API endpoints. Explain integration with inventory management to prevent over-selling. Address common issues such as stock unavailability after order placement, order modification workflows, and synchronization with other sales documents. Provide usage patterns for different business scenarios and performance optimization tips for order processing at scale.

wiki_catalogs.name: Stock Tracking
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the stock tracking functionality. Explain how the system tracks stock levels through explicit stock-in and stock-out operations, and how these are recorded in the database. Document the integration between stock movement forms and the underlying API endpoints that update inventory levels. Include examples from StockIn.js and StockOut.js components showing how users record inventory receipts and issues. Describe the real-time updates to item stock levels and how the system prevents negative inventory where configured. Explain the relationship between stock tracking and other modules like sales (delivery) and purchase (goods receipt). Address common issues such as timing of stock updates, handling partial deliveries, and reconciliation of physical vs system stock. Provide performance considerations for high-volume stock movement operations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Goods Receipt Notes (GRN)
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Goods Receipt Notes (GRN) sub-feature in ezbillify-v1. Explain how partial receipts are handled and how the system updates PO status (pending, partially_received, received). Address common issues such as mismatched quantities, duplicate GRN entries, and inventory sync failures. Provide troubleshooting guidance and performance tips for batch processing of GRNs in high-volume environments.

wiki_catalogs.name: General Ledger
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the general ledger system in ezbillify-v1. Explain how the general ledger is derived from journal entries and organized by chart of accounts. Document the implementation of account-level transaction tracking, including balance calculations and period-over-period comparisons. Include examples from the GeneralLedgerList component showing how users view transaction details for specific accounts. Describe the API structure for retrieving ledger data and filtering by date range, account type, or transaction status. Explain the relationship between the general ledger and subsidiary ledgers for customers, vendors, and inventory. Address common issues such as ledger imbalances, reconciliation discrepancies, and performance optimization for large datasets. Provide examples of how the general ledger serves as the foundation for financial reporting.

wiki_catalogs.name: e-Way Bills
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the e-Way Bills sub-feature of the GST compliance system. Thoroughly explain the implementation details of creating, validating, and managing e-Way Bills for goods transportation. Document the complete workflow from selecting an invoice to generate an e-Way Bill, including required fields like distance, vehicle number, and transporter details. Explain the relationship between the frontend UI, API endpoints, and the gstService.js business logic that handles the Whitebooks API integration. Address common issues like e-Way Bill validity period errors, transporter information validation, and reconciliation between e-Invoice and e-Way Bill data. wiki_catalogs.name: Tax Rates Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Tax Rates Management system in ezbillify-v1. Explain the implementation of tax rate configurations including GST rates (0%, 5%, 12%, 18%, 28%) and their composition schemes. Document the validation rules for tax rate creation, effective date management, and jurisdiction-specific tax rules. Include practical examples of setting up new tax rates, handling tax rate changes over time, and troubleshooting common issues like incorrect tax application or missing tax codes. wiki_catalogs.name: Purchase Reports
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the purchase reporting module in ezbillify-v1. Document the API endpoint at /api/accounting/reports/purchase-reports.js, detailing the supported query parameters, response structure, and error conditions. Include practical examples from the codebase showing how procurement patterns, supplier performance, and cost analysis are generated. Address common issues such as mismatched purchase amounts, duplicate bill entries, and currency conversion errors in multi-currency scenarios. wiki_catalogs.name: State Management System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the state management system in ezbillify-v1. Detail the implementation of React Context API for global state management across critical domains including authentication (AuthContext), company data (CompanyContext), branch selection (BranchContext), UI theme (ThemeContext), and user feedback (ToastContext). Explain how custom hooks (useAuth, useCompany, useToast) encapsulate context consumption logic and provide a clean interface for components. Document the state initialization, update patterns, and cross-context dependencies. Include examples of how state flows from context providers to consuming components in modules like sales, purchase, and master data. Address performance considerations such as context splitting to prevent unnecessary re-renders, and describe error handling and persistence strategies using useLocalStorage. Provide guidance on extending the state management system with new contexts or hooks.

wiki_catalogs.name: Print Templates
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the print template system in ezbillify-v1. Detail the implementation of HTML-based templates for various document types (invoices, quotations, reports) and paper formats (58mm, 80mm, A4, A5, A3). Explain how templates are structured, customized, and applied to different document categories. Document the merge fields available in templates and how they connect to the underlying data model. wiki_catalogs.name: Server-Side Data Processing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the server-side data processing architecture in ezbillify-v1. Explain how Next.js API routes handle incoming requests, starting with middleware like auth.js for authentication and rate limiting. Describe the request lifecycle: API route → middleware validation → service layer invocation (e.g., accountingService) → Supabase database operations via db.js → response formatting. Use the journal entries API as a concrete example to illustrate data validation, transaction handling, error logging, and success responses. Document the integration with Supabase, including row-level security policies and real-time subscriptions if applicable. Explain how database migrations (e.g., adding UPI fields) are structured and applied. Address data integrity constraints, error handling strategies for database failures, and performance considerations such as query optimization and indexing. Include guidance on debugging API routes and monitoring server-side performance.

wiki_catalogs.name: Balance Sheet
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Balance Sheet component in ezbillify-v1. Explain how the component retrieves and presents assets, liabilities, and equity as of a specific date using the accountingService.getBalanceSheet method and the Supabase RPC 'get_balance_sheet'. Document the data structure including current vs. non-current classifications and the calculation of total assets, liabilities, and equity. Describe the UI implementation with collapsible sections, responsive layout, and export capabilities. Include examples from the BalanceSheet.js component demonstrating date selection, data formatting in INR currency, and reconciliation logic. Explain how the balance sheet adheres to accounting principles and supports financial health assessment. Address common issues such as unbalanced sheets, stale data, and account categorization errors. Provide guidance on analyzing liquidity, leverage, and solvency using the balance sheet data.

wiki_catalogs.name: Custom Hooks
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the custom React hooks used to consume context state in ezbillify-v1. Detail the implementation of useAuth, useCompany, usePermissions, and useToast hooks, which encapsulate context consumption logic and provide type-safe, reusable interfaces across components. Explain how each hook uses useContext to access its corresponding context and includes safety checks to throw descriptive errors if used outside the provider. Document the return values, including state variables and action functions, and show practical usage examples in components like AuthGuard, CompanySetup, and DashboardLayout. Describe how these hooks abstract complexity, promote consistency, and enable easy testing. Address performance implications and how they integrate with other hooks like useAPI and useLocalStorage for state persistence.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Fetching Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the data fetching architecture in ezbillify-v1. Detail the implementation of the useAPI custom hook, including its caching mechanism using Map objects, request deduplication, and token management via Supabase authentication. Explain the authenticatedFetch method's handling of headers, error responses, and automatic token refresh. Document the service layer pattern where domain-specific services (accountingService, customerService) encapsulate business logic and interact with API routes. Describe the structure of API routes in the pages/api directory, including RESTful conventions, dynamic route handling ([id].js), and middleware integration. Cover data fetching strategies across different scenarios: server-side rendering, client-side fetching, and periodic refresh mechanisms. Explain caching behavior, cache invalidation, and error handling patterns. Include performance optimization techniques such as request deduplication and response caching with TTL management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on setting up the ezbillify-v1 development environment. Provide step-by-step instructions for cloning the repository, installing dependencies, configuring environment variables (including Supabase connection details), and running the application locally. Include platform-specific considerations for macOS, Linux, and Windows. Document the development workflow with hot reloading, API route testing, and database migration execution. wiki_catalogs.name: Data Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the data flow architecture in ezbillify-v1. Illustrate with specific examples such as fetching journal entries: JournalList component → useAPI hook → accountingService.getJournalEntries() → API route /api/accounting/journal-entries → Supabase query → response formatting → state update in component. wiki_catalogs.name: Architecture Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the ezbillify-v1 application. Describe the high-level design as a Next.js full-stack application with component-based frontend, service layer business logic, and API routes as backend endpoints. Document the architectural patterns used: React Context for state management, custom hooks for reusable logic, service layer pattern for business logic separation, and middleware for authentication/authorization. Explain component interactions, data flows from API routes to services to components, and integration patterns with Supabase. Include system context diagrams and component breakdowns. Address cross-cutting concerns like security, error handling, and performance. Document technology stack decisions and trade-offs.

wiki_catalogs.name: Payments
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Payments feature in ezbillify-v1. Detail the implementation of customer payment collection, including multiple payment methods (cash, bank transfer, UPI), partial payments, and payment allocation to specific invoices. Document the domain model showing relationships between payments, invoices, customers, and bank accounts. Include concrete examples from PaymentForm.js and the payments API routes. Explain integration with accounting for ledger updates and bank reconciliation. Address common issues such as incorrect payment allocation, currency conversion errors, and reconciliation discrepancies. Provide guidance on secure payment handling, audit trails, and performance considerations for high-frequency payment processing.

wiki_catalogs.name: Stock Valuation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the stock valuation functionality. Explain how the system calculates the value of inventory using cost-based methods and integrates with the accounting module for financial reporting. Document the implementation in StockValuation.js and its use of item cost data, current stock levels, and valuation methods (FIFO, weighted average, etc.). Include examples of generating stock valuation reports and how these values flow into financial statements like the balance sheet. Describe the relationship between item cost prices, purchase history, and valuation calculations. Address common issues such as outdated cost prices, valuation discrepancies, and handling items with zero cost. Provide guidance on inventory valuation best practices, periodic valuation runs, and reconciliation with physical inventory counts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Payments Made
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Payments Made sub-feature in ezbillify-v1. Detail the implementation of recording payments to vendors, including multiple payment methods and partial payments against bills. Document the data model with fields like payment_mode, reference_number, and linkage to bills and bank accounts. Include examples from the codebase showing how PaymentMadeForm captures transaction details and updates payable balances in real-time. Explain the integration with bank reconciliation and general ledger entries. Address common issues such as payment reconciliation errors, incorrect allocation to bills, and handling of payment reversals. Provide best practices for audit trail maintenance and performance tips for processing bulk payments.

wiki_catalogs.name: Financial Statements
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the financial statements module in ezbillify-v1. Explain the implementation of key financial statements including Profit & Loss, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow Statement. Document how these reports are generated from trial balance data and general ledger accounts, with proper classification of income, expenses, assets, liabilities, and equity. Include examples from the ProfitLoss, BalanceSheet, and CashFlowStatement components showing how users view and analyze financial performance. Describe the API endpoints that power these reports and their filtering capabilities by date range and account categories. Explain the automation of financial statement generation from transaction data. Address common issues such as incorrect account classification, period mismatches, and presentation format requirements. Provide guidance on interpreting financial ratios and trends derived from these statements.

wiki_catalogs.name: GST Credential Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the GST Credential Management sub-feature of the GST compliance system. Thoroughly explain the implementation of securely storing and managing GST credentials for integration with GST Suvidha Providers like Whitebooks. Document the complete workflow from credential input through the GSTLoginModal to secure storage in the database and usage in API authentication. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase, such as the encryption of sensitive fields like client_secret and the handling of sandbox vs production environments. Explain the relationship between the frontend components, API routes, and the gstService.js business logic that manages token generation. Address common issues like credential expiration, multi-company credential management, and secure credential rotation. Provide security best practices for handling GST credentials and compliance with data protection regulations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Bank Accounts Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Bank Accounts Management system in ezbillify-v1. Explain the implementation of bank account configurations including account numbers, IFSC codes, and UPI integration capabilities. Document the UPI QR code generation functionality, secure storage of banking credentials, and validation rules for bank details. Describe the API endpoints for CRUD operations and UPI QR code generation, including security considerations. Include practical examples of setting up a new bank account with UPI, generating payment QR codes, and troubleshooting common issues like invalid bank details or QR code generation failures. Address the database schema changes for UPI fields and integration with payment processing in sales and purchase modules.

wiki_catalogs.name: Financial Reports
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the financial reporting module in ezbillify-v1. Document the API endpoints at /api/accounting/reports/balance-sheet.js, /api/accounting/reports/profit-loss.js, and /api/accounting/reports/cash-flow.js, detailing the accounting periods, comparison periods, and consolidation options. Include practical examples from the codebase showing how financial ratios, year-over-year comparisons, and multi-period analysis are generated. Explain the integration between financial reports and the chart of accounts structure. Address common issues such as incorrect account classifications, timing differences in revenue recognition, and errors in cash flow categorization. Provide optimization strategies for financial closing processes, including period locking, audit trail maintenance, and performance optimization for large ledger datasets.

Address common issues like session expiration, permission errors, and authentication flow debugging. Provide security best practices and performance considerations for authentication.

wiki_catalogs.name: Sales Returns

Address common issues such as partial returns, expired return windows, and tax reversal calculations. Explain the relationship between bank accounts in the chart of accounts and the reconciliation module. Describe the integration between payment terms and customer/vendor credit management, including due date calculations and aging reports. Include practical examples of setting up standard payment terms, configuring custom terms, and troubleshooting common issues like incorrect due date calculations or payment term application errors. Document the integration between the frontend scheduler and backend systems for automated report generation and email delivery. Include rollback procedures and disaster recovery planning guidance.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: EZBillify V1

## 1. Project Introduction

EZBillify V1 is a comprehensive business management platform designed to streamline financial operations, inventory management, and GST compliance for modern enterprises. The application serves as a central hub for businesses to manage their accounting, sales, purchases, and reporting needs with a focus on Indian GST regulations.

**Core Goals and Objectives:**
- Provide an intuitive interface for financial management and reporting
- Ensure automated GST compliance including e-invoicing and e-way bills
- Offer real-time inventory tracking and management
- Enable multi-device accessibility for business operations
- Streamline the billing and invoicing process with professional templates

**Target Audience:**
- Small to medium-sized businesses in India requiring GST-compliant solutions
- Accounting professionals managing multiple client accounts
- Business owners seeking digital transformation of their financial operations
- Enterprises needing integrated solutions for sales, purchases, and inventory

## 2. Technical Architecture

The EZBillify V1 application follows a modern web architecture built on the Next.js framework with a component-based React frontend and API routes for backend functionality. The application leverages Supabase for authentication and database operations, providing a robust foundation for data management.

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client] --> B[API Layer]
    B --> C[Business Logic]
    C --> D[Data Access]
    D --> E[(Database)]
```

The architecture demonstrates a clear separation of concerns with distinct layers for presentation, business logic, and data persistence. The application uses React Context for state management, custom hooks for reusable logic, and a service layer for business operations.

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- `src/pages/index.js` - Landing page and marketing site
- `src/pages/dashboard.js` - Main application dashboard
- `src/pages/_app.js` - Application root with context providers

### Core Modules
- `src/components/` - UI components organized by functional areas
- `src/context/AuthContext.js` - Authentication and user state management
- `src/services/companyService.js` - Business logic for company operations
- `src/pages/api/` - API routes for backend functionality

### Configuration Approach
- `package.json` - Project dependencies and scripts
- `tailwind.config.js` - Styling configuration
- Environment variables for Supabase integration

### External Dependencies
- `@supabase/supabase-js` - Database and authentication
- `next` - Framework
- `react` - UI library
- `@react-pdf/renderer` - PDF generation
- `xlsx` - Excel file processing

### Integration Points
- `src/pages/api/auth/` - Authentication API endpoints
- `src/services/utils/supabase.js` - Supabase integration
- `src/pages/api/companies/setup.js` - Company setup API

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Frontend Components] --> B[Context Providers]
    B --> C[API Routes]
    C --> D[Supabase]
    D --> E[Database]
    A --> F[Service Layer]
    F --> C
```

## 4. Key Features

### Authentication and User Management
The application implements a robust authentication system with email verification, OTP-based login, and role-based access control. The system distinguishes between admin users and workforce users, providing appropriate access levels.

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Idle
    Idle --> EmailVerification: User Registration
    EmailVerification --> OTPLogin: Email Verified
    OTPLogin --> Dashboard: Authentication Successful
    Dashboard --> Idle: Logout
```

### Financial Management
EZBillify provides comprehensive financial management capabilities including:
- Sales and purchase management
- Inventory tracking
- Accounting reports (Profit & Loss, Balance Sheet, etc.)
- GST compliance features

### Document Generation and Templates
The system supports various document templates for different paper sizes and formats, including thermal printer compatibility. This enables businesses to generate professional invoices and reports tailored to their specific printing requirements.

### Real-time Data and Caching
The application implements caching strategies to improve performance, particularly for dashboard statistics. The company service includes a caching mechanism to reduce database load while maintaining data freshness.

### Mobile Integration
The project includes considerations for mobile app integration, with tracking endpoints for login events and specific documentation for mobile app login tracking.
</blog>
